Sentencas: This work considers the reactivity at the gas/solid interface for energy conversion systems based on ZrO2, such as solid oxide fuel cells, SOFCs, and the related charge transfer.
Titulo: In Situ Surface Monitoring of Charge Transfer during Oxidation of Zirconia at Elevated Temperatures

Sentencas: We consider the effect of a quasi-isolated surface structure, QISS, on the reactivity of yttria-stabilized zirconia, YSZ, with oxygen at elevated temperatures.
Titulo: In Situ Surface Monitoring of Charge Transfer during Oxidation of Zirconia at Elevated Temperatures

Sentencas: The charge transfer associated with oxidation of both YSZ and Nb-doped YSZ in the range 973-1173 K was determined by in situ surface monitoring using work function, WF, measurements.
Titulo: In Situ Surface Monitoring of Charge Transfer during Oxidation of Zirconia at Elevated Temperatures

Sentencas: We show that the reactivity at the O-2/YSZ interface can be enhanced by incorporation of pentavalent cations, such as Nb5+ ions, into the QISS that exhibits the functions of both fast ionic oxygen conductor and metallic electrode.
Titulo: In Situ Surface Monitoring of Charge Transfer during Oxidation of Zirconia at Elevated Temperatures

Sentencas: It has been documented that surface doping of YSZ with niobium results in removal of oxygen chemisorption-related surface potential barrier that prevents oxygen incorporation into the lattice of YSZ.
Titulo: In Situ Surface Monitoring of Charge Transfer during Oxidation of Zirconia at Elevated Temperatures

Sentencas: This finding paves the way for the development of novel materials for energy conversion devices, such as SOFCs, with enhanced performance through surface processing.
Titulo: In Situ Surface Monitoring of Charge Transfer during Oxidation of Zirconia at Elevated Temperatures
